transcripts.text: Thank you. Bob.  Bob is ... one of our official sources.  he's anonymous because ... there's a lot of reprisals against the yellow vest ... movement because again he wants it to be a movement ... that no one speaks for.  but he does talk to a lot of the ... organizers.  he is there on the ground he is there in ... and he has a lot of on the ground information that has been very solid and very good and of course gives you a perspective that you're not going to get anywhere else.  and what bob has been telling me has been absolutely fascinating because i don't know if you know i know this bob but i get bob's not your real name it's just an anonymous name that we're saying here.  i've been watching some western tv and again the last thing that happened After this crazy very violent I think the most ... violent ever 18th week protest.  the mainstream ... media in America mentioned it for 2 minutes maybe at Max ... and I was like oh yeah there's some French people ... protesting about fuel.  and of course that's not even.  that's ... That's not even any of the story.  And that's why I wanted to talk to you and get everything.  Of course, this video is probably going to go longer than 10 minutes. So it is now allowed through the urgency state laws that were enabled, I think it was a couple of months ago, because of the terrorist attacks. Is this like martial law?  No, it's not martial law.  But that's the tricky thing.  In France, because of these laws, you don't need martial law to bring these military personnel on the ground to protect certain institutions.  That's what they say, but you don't protect institutions with military personnel.  if it's a social demonstration.  or any demonstration that is coming from a social uproar in the country.  So the word terrorist is now being used many times on TV shows.  describing last Saturday's revolt on the Champs Elysees.

So BMTV probably, the CNN of France and all the other mainstream media outlets are saying if you're protesting, if you're a part of the Yellow Vest movement, that's the media, I mean kind of the state media talking point, right?

I mean, there's also been a huge discussion. And if I could interrupt you, I talked to some of the police officers and they are way overworked.  Yeah, absolutely.  Extremely stressed out. Start the aggression.  Start the violence.  From everything I've seen.  From everything I've seen personally, myself.
